conclusion: Liquid will flow out from A, B, and C and needs to be predicted which container (D, E, or F) it will flow into after passing through baffles.
Liquid flows out from A (orange liquid).
The orange liquid hits the black baffle, which is slanted downward to the left.
The liquid follows the slope of the black baffle and moves leftward.
After leaving the black baffle, the orange liquid flows directly into container D (purple).
Liquid flows out from B (cyan liquid).
The cyan liquid hits the purple baffle, which is slanted downward to the right.
The liquid follows the slope of the purple baffle and moves rightward.
After leaving the purple baffle, the cyan liquid flows directly into container E (red).
Liquid flows out from C (pink liquid).
The pink liquid hits the cyan baffle, which is slanted downward to the left.
The liquid follows the slope of the cyan baffle and moves leftward.
After leaving the cyan baffle, the pink liquid flows directly into container F (green).
Liquid from A flows into D, liquid from B flows into E, and liquid from C flows into F.
